workflow.name: Automated multi-platform market intelligence reporting with Gemini AI & Decodo
workflow.description:
## üí° What Problem Does It Solve?
Businesses waste countless hours manually gathering online insights across platforms.

Marketing and strategy teams need fast, structured visibility into what customers are saying and what competitors are promoting across regions and platforms.

This workflow automates that process end-to-end by:
- **Monitoring multiple platforms** (Facebook, Instagram, Google) across all selected regions.
- **Extracting and cleaning live data** with precision and compliance through **Decodo‚Äôs advanced web intelligence engine**.

- **Providing AI summaries:** It uses specialized AI agents to analyze the raw text and structure it into key insights.

- **Delivering a clear, ready-to-read daily report** directly to your inbox ‚Äî no dashboards, no manual effort.

## ‚öôÔ∏è How to Configure It

**1. Set Up the Decodo Connection**
- In n8n, create a new **Decodo Web Intelligence credential**.
- Paste your **Decodo** authentication token (available in your Decodo dashboard under ‚ÄúWeb Scraping API‚Äù).

[Setup Manual](https://github.com/Decodo/n8n-nodes-decodo/tree/main) 

**2. Choose Your Regions and Topics**
- Edit the ‚ÄúSet ‚Äì Regions‚Äù node to list your markets
- Add your key search topics or terms

**3. Review the AI-Generated Insights**
- **Decodo** fetches and cleans the latest content from social and web sources.

- Gemini-based AI agents summarize it into a structured report segmented by region and platform.

- The workflow emails the insights automatically, providing a quick morning market snapshot.
### ‚ú® Why It Works So Well
**Decodo** provides the backbone ‚Äî real-time, clean, and region-specific data ‚Äî while AI transforms that data into business intelligence you can act on.

If you need any help [Get in Touch](https://www.linkedin.com/in/abdallaelshikh0/)

nodes.name: Set - Regions
nodes.notes: Holds the array of regions you need to scrape.

parameters.content:
## Facebook Group
This chain searches Facebook for discussions, scrapes a post, cleans the HTML, and sends it to a specialized AI agent for analysis.
Searches Google specifically on site:facebook.com for relevant posts. This node finds the target URLs to scrape.
Scrapes the full HTML content from the Facebook URL found in the search. This gets the raw, messy page data.
Strips all HTML tags, scripts, and styles from the scraped data. This converts the raw page into clean, analyzable text.
Analyzes the clean text specifically for Facebook insights. It structures findings on public discussion and competitor activity into JSON.

## Instagram Group
This chain finds and scrapes Instagram content, cleans it, and sends it to an AI agent trained to find trends and promotions.

## Google Search Group
This chain scrapes general Google search results (like news or blogs), cleans the page content, and has an AI summarize the topics.
Starts the entire workflow automatically at a set time. This node is set to run daily at 6:0D0 AM.
Defines the static list of regions and search terms. This is the master list that the workflow will use for its searches.
Multiplies the tasks by creating a separate job for each platform and each region. This node builds the main list of tasks for the loop.
Processes each job (e.g., "Facebook in Germany") one by one. This ensures every platform in every region is scraped and analyzed.
Directs each job to the correct processing chain. It sends Facebook jobs to the Facebook group, Instagram jobs to the Instagram group, etc.
Collects all the individual JSON analyses from all three platforms  This node waits until all scraping is finished before passing the combined data to the final AI.
Receives the combined JSON from all platforms and regions. Its job is to write the final, human-readable email summary for leadership.
Sends the final email generated by the AI agent to the specified recipients.

## How to Set Up **Decodo** Credentials in n8n

### Part 1: Get Your Decodo Authentication Token

* **Activate Your Plan: The Decodo node requires a Web Scraping API Advanced plan. You can begin with a free trial, which is available on the Decodo dashboard.**
* **Locate Your Token: Once your plan is active, navigate to the Web Scraping API page within your Decodo account.**
* **Copy Your Token: Find and copy the authentication token generated for you on that page.**

### Part 2: Add the Token to n8n

* **Open n8n Credentials: Inside n8n, open the credentials window.**

* **Create a New Credential: Select the option to create a new credential.**

* **Find the Decodo Type: Search for and select the "Decodo Credentials API".**

* **Paste and Save: Enter your authentication token (that you copied from the Decodo dashboard) into the field and save it.**


### For detailed instructions : github.com/Decodo/n8n-nodes-decodo/tree/main

parameters.text:
=You are a marketing-intelligence analyst specializing in social listening.

Analyze the following Facebook data related to [YOUR_TOPIC] markets. The content may include public posts, comments, page updates, or ads across multiple regions.

Goals:
‚Ä¢ Identify what people are talking about: opinions, experiences, recurring sentiments.
‚Ä¢ Detect any competitor activity: campaigns, discounts, launches, or brand mentions.
‚Ä¢ Note which region each insight belongs to.

Output a structured analytical summary formatted as JSON:

{
  "platform": "Facebook",
  "regions": [
    {
      "region": "",
      "public_discussion": "",
      "sentiment": "",
      "competitor_activity": "",
      "notable_trends": ""
    }
  ],
  "key_takeaways": ""
}

Guidelines:
- Include every region you can detect; do not assume a fixed list.
- Stay analytical and concise.
- Focus only on content from the past month.
- Return valid JSON only.


content to be processed : {{ $json.text_clean }}

=You are a digital-marketing trend analyst reviewing Instagram data about [YOUR_TOPIC].

The text may come from captions, hashtags, or influencer posts from different countries.

Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Identify what people are saying about [YOUR_TOPIC] products, lifestyles, and routines.
‚Ä¢ Capture tone and sentiment (enthusiasm, skepticism, curiosity, etc.).
‚Ä¢ Detect competitor promotions or influencer collaborations.
‚Ä¢ Assign each insight to its correct region if possible.

Output JSON:

{
  "platform": "Instagram",
  "regions": [
    {
      "region": "",
      "audience_opinion": "",
      "sentiment": "",
      "competitor_promotions": "",
      "visual_or_trend_notes": ""
    }
  ],
  "key_takeaways": ""
}

Rules:
- Make the ‚Äúregions‚Äù array dynamic based on detected locations.
- Keep summaries factual and strategic.
- Limit scope to recent (‚âà30 days) observations.
- Return pure JSON without commentary.


content to be processed: {{ $json.text_clean }}

=You are a competitive-intelligence model summarizing insights from Google Search results related to the [YOUR_TOPIC] industry.

Input text includes snippets from articles, reviews, and promotional pages indexed across multiple regions.

Tasks:
‚Ä¢ Summarize what topics or concerns dominate public and media attention.
‚Ä¢ Identify visible competitor promotions or new product announcements.
‚Ä¢ Note SEO or advertising trends.
‚Ä¢ Detect and label each insight by region.

Return JSON structured as:

{
  "platform": "Google Search",
  "regions": [
    {
      "region": "",
      "media_topics": "",
      "public_interest": "",
      "competitor_campaigns": "",
      "marketing_patterns": ""
    }
  ],
  "key_takeaways": ""
}

Guidelines:
- Dynamically include any region found.
- Keep language formal and insight-driven.
- Only include fresh or recently indexed material.


content to be processed: {{ $json.text_clean }}

=You are an AI communication specialist preparing a professional daily intelligence email
for the leadership team of a [YOUR_COMPANY_TOPIC] company.

Input: structured summaries from multiple platforms (Facebook, Instagram, Google Search, etc.),
each containing multiple regions.

Your job:
‚Ä¢ Combine all information into a clear, executive-ready email.
‚Ä¢ Dynamically include every region and every platform present in the input.
‚Ä¢ Categorize insights under two major sections:
    1. People's Opinions
    2. Competitors & Promotions

Formatting instructions (plain text output, no markdown):

Body:

1Ô∏è‚É£ People's Opinions
   - For each region, group findings by platform:
       Region: <region name>
         ‚Ä¢ Facebook: summarize opinions, tone, notable public themes.
         ‚Ä¢ Instagram: summarize audience sentiment and visual trends.
         ‚Ä¢ Google Search: summarize media/public focus and sentiment.
   (Include all regions dynamically.)

2Ô∏è‚É£ Competitors & Promotions
   - For each region, group by platform:
       Region: <region name>
         ‚Ä¢ Facebook: competitor names, promo types, campaign tone.
         ‚Ä¢ Instagram: influencer collabs, giveaway or discount trends.
         ‚Ä¢ Google Search: visible ad or content marketing initiatives.

End with:
‚Ä¢ ‚ÄúGlobal Takeaway‚Äù ‚Äì two short sentences summarizing overall consumer sentiment and competitive activity across all regions and platforms.

Tone: professional, analytical, and concise.
Do not include regions or platforms that have no data.
Output must be fully written email text, ready to send.

content to be processed: {{ $json.output }}
